source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_1<tab>Sound o' hammerin' bring you in from the street, did it, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>? It's well that you find the din invitin', for the Armorers' Guild is not the place for quiet reverie.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_1<tab>あら、冒険者ね？
ここは、金属の特性を知り尽くし、金属を自在に加工する
板金の腕を磨く職人が集う「甲冑師ギルド」よ。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_2<tab>If the clangor o' metal strikin' metal is music to your ears, mayhap you've the spirit of a shipwright.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_2<tab>甲冑師になれば、板金の甲冑一式はもちろん、
ギャザラーやクラフターたちが愛用する道具だって作れるよ。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_3<tab>Are you of a mind to join our guild? Take it from me, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>, there's no greater joy than workin' a shapeless lump of iron into a shinin' breastplate with your own hands. What say you, then?
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_3<tab>あなた、甲冑師の仕事に興味があるのなら、
甲冑師ギルドに入ってみない？

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_Q1_000_1<tab>Do you wish to join the Armorers' Guild?
target: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_Q1_000_1<tab>甲冑師ギルドに入門したい？

TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_11<tab>あら、そうなの？
ちょっぴり残念だけど、無理強いする気もないわ。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_12<tab>Well, I'll be here if you decide you need another earful o' why our guild is the right choice for you.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_12<tab>でも、もし興味が湧いたら、また声をかけてね。
甲冑師ギルドについて、たっぷり案内してあげる。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_21<tab>Hmmm... Now that I take a closer look, I don't think you're ready.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_21<tab>あら……ごめんなさいね、今のあなたじゃ、
甲冑師ギルドに入ってもらえないわ。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_22<tab>We can't be takin' on initiates that lack the inner steel to stick with a discipline for more than a bell or two─not in troubled times like these. We need people with perseverance. Show me you've got some, an' we'll talk.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_22<tab>物騒なご時世だし、自分の身ぐらいは守れないと、
甲冑師としてもやっていけないからね。
もうちょっと腕っ節を鍛えたら、また声をかけてちょうだい。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_SYSTEM_000_23<tab>Before you can take up another discipline, you must first complete the level 10 quest of your starting class.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_SYSTEM_000_23<tab>他のクラスを学ぶためには、最初に選んだバトルクラスの
レベル10クラスクエストを完了する必要があります。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_31<tab>Well said, <var 08 E905 ((lass)) ((lad)) /var>. Now, we should cover a bit o' guild history afore forgin' ahead with the formalities.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_31<tab>はい！　しかと聞いたわ、この耳で。
甲冑師になりたいっていう、あなたの気持ちをね。
じゃあ、さっそくギルドの歴史のお勉強しましょうか？

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_32<tab>The armorer's craft is an offshoot o' blacksmithin'. Time was when armorers an' smitties were one an' the same.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_32<tab>甲冑師のルーツはズバリ鍛冶師よ。
甲冑師と鍛冶師は、もとはひとつの存在だったの。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_33<tab>But as the years trickled by, the techniques for workin' sheet metal into armor plates became a specialized trade.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_33<tab>それが時代が下るにつれて、
甲冑の素材を作る板金加工技術が専門化してね。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_34<tab>An' the smitties who showed uncommon skill an' passion for this trade earned 'emselves the title of “armorer.”
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_34<tab>鍛冶師のなかでも、板金技術に秀で、
主に甲冑を手掛ける職人を甲冑師と呼ぶようになったの。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_35<tab>Now, as you can probably imagine, the skills necessary for makin' armor are also needed for shipbuildin'. But buildin' ships is a bit harder than knockin' out simple helms, which led those armorers who were good enough to work on boats to claim the title o' “shipwright.” 'Course, it was one thing callin' armorers blacksmiths an' shipwrights armorers, but it was quite <var 1A 02 /var>another<var 1A 01 /var> callin' shipwrights blacksmiths, 'cause buildin' a ship an' makin' a hatchet couldn't be more different.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_35<tab>板金技術は、造船にも不可欠でね。
でも、熟練した腕が求められるから、
造船に携わる職人は、特に「造船師」と呼ばれるわ。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_36<tab>It seemed as though a line needed drawin', an' seein' as how Limsa Lominsa was built on the strength o' her navy, you can imagine why the armorers chose to cut their ties with the smitties, an' established a guild o' their own.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_36<tab>このように板金技術は、
リムサ・ロミンサの発展に大いに貢献してきたわけ。
だから、単独で甲冑師ギルドが設立されたのよ。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_37<tab>As for the smitties, well, the whole notion of an independent Armorers' Guild never did sit well with 'em, an' there's been a fair old rivalry between our two factions ever since. Always tryin' to outdo each other, we are.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_37<tab>こんな経緯だから、甲冑師ギルドと鍛冶師ギルドは、
今でもライバル関係にあって、互いに技術向上を競っているの。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_38<tab>Which is why we're ever on the lookout for new talent to help us keep the smitty bastards in their place! All you need do is impress the forgemaster, an' we can start you on your trainin'.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_38<tab>というわけで、甲冑師ギルドでは新人を大歓迎よ。
入門の条件は、たったのひとつ。
ギルドマスターに承認をもらうだけ。

source: TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_39<tab>Be warned─Forgemaster H'naanza's tongue could strip the scales off a fishback at forty paces. Sayin' that, you won't find a fairer mistress this side o' the Strait o' Merlthor. Let me know when you've mustered the courage to speak with her, an' I'll see to the rest.
target:
TEXT_CLSARM001_00186_GWAHNAKO_000_39<tab>ギルドマスターはハ・ナンザ姐さんっていって、
仕事には厳しいけど、信頼できる人よ。
紹介してあげるから、心の準備ができたら私に声をかけて。
